alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mojave Desert, Including the Mojave National Preserve; Morongo Basin; Western Mojave Desert (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 21 at 9:00AM PDT until August 21 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible thanks to moisture from Hurricane Hilary. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following areas, Eastern Mojave Desert, Morongo Basin and Western Mojave Desert. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. Low water crossings and washes around Yucca Valley will remain prone to flooding . * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mojave Desert, Including the Mojave National Preserve; Morongo Basin; Western Mojave Desert
